[[File:Wappinger (Earth-616) from Ruins of Ravencroft Carnage Vol 1 1 002.jpg|left|thumb]]
The '''Wappinger''' were a tribe of [[Native Americans]] who lived on the east coast of [[North America]] in a region that would one day be [[Westchester County]], [[New York (State)|New York]].

The land where the [[Ravencroft Institute]] was built had been seen as cursed by the local indigenous tribes since before the 15th century, having been claimed as the territory of a [[Cult of Knull (Earth-616)|cannibalistic cult]] that worshiped the dark god [[Knull (Earth-616)|Knull]].{{r|Ruins of Ravencroft: Carnage Vol 1 1}}
[[File:Wappinger (Earth-616) and Church of the New Darkness (Earth-616) from Ruins of Ravencroft Carnage Vol 1 1 001.jpg|left|thumb]]

A Wappinger shaman cursed [[Sanctum Sanctorum|another piece of land]] in New York to bind the chaos-entity [[Tyanon (Earth-616)|Tyanon]] to that place and bar her full access to [[Earth]].{{r|Doctor Strange: From the Marvel Vault Vol 1 1}} The site continued to serve as a place for arcane Native American Indian rituals.{{r|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe Vol 1 3}} Shamans of the Wappinger tribe were known to journey there for vision quests.{{r|Doctor Strange Vol 4 2}}

In the 17th century, the English began settling in the region and the Wappinger tried to warn them not to build there; however construction begana single wooden cell constructed in 1664 to house [[Cortland Kasady (Earth-616)|Cortland Kasady]], a settler who had been driven insane by the cult and become a murderous cannibal.{{r|Ruins of Ravencroft: Carnage Vol 1 1}}
